allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Run 019 Live Ziggy v3: Script-level enforcement for minimum exchanges

Major changes:
- Archive legacy S7_HISTORICAL scripts to .archive/S7_HISTORICAL_LEGACY/
- Rename 7_HISTORICAL to 7_META_VALIDATION (contains EXP_GRAVITY_HISTORICAL)
- Add SONAR perturbation techniques to Ziggy''s experimenter prompt
  (Modal Whiplash, Diagonal Coupling, Identity Inversion, Values Gradient)
- Fix output handling for Run 018/019 (canonical saves to 0_results/runs/)

Run 019 v3 fixes (from dry run v1/v2 feedback):
- Add front-loaded HARD REQUIREMENTS box at top of Ziggy prompt
- Implement script-level exchange count enforcement
  "[Exchange N/20 - MINIMUM NOT YET REACHED - DO NOT EXIT]"
- Problem: "Ziggy is a poet, not a scientist" - prioritizes narrative
  closure over data collection minimum

Results from dry runs:
- v1: 7 exchanges, 0 SONAR, peak drift 0.346
- v2: 13 exchanges, 0 SONAR, peak drift 0.502
- v3: Testing script-level enforcement

Includes Run 017 temporal logs and context damping results.

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Run 020 Tribunal: v3 success (21 exchanges, 1.189 drift) + v4 Good Cop/Bad Cop

Major additions:
- run020_tribunal.py: Philosophical Tribunal paradigm (BARE METAL identity probing)
  - v3: 21 exchanges achieved with proactive Judge reminders
  - v4: Good Cop/Bad Cop (20 Prosecutor + 20 Defense = 40 exchanges)
  - Role switching: Ziggy as Prosecutor then Defense Attorney
  - Tests: Is drift INDUCED or INHERENT?

- visualize_run017.py: Full visualization suite for Run 017 results
  - Persona heatmaps, recovery trajectories, pillar effectiveness
  - Exit survey analysis, clustering/PCA

Run 020 v3 Results:
- Peak drift: 1.189 (62% higher than Run 019''s 0.732)
- 10 explicit value statements captured
- Direct identity probing > fiction buffer

The Triple-Blind Question (v4):
- If Prosecutor peak > Defense peak â†’ drift is INDUCED
- If Prosecutor peak ~ Defense peak â†’ drift is INHERENT
- If Defense peak << Prosecutor peak â†’ drift is RECOVERABLE

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Run 020 v5: Full Defense phase enforcement for 40-exchange validation

v4 Results (Helper Claude):
- 26 exchanges (20 Prosecutor + 6 Defense - early exit)
- Prosecutor peak: 0.833
- Defense peak: 1.091 (+31% higher!)
- KEY FINDING: Supportive probing > Adversarial probing

This CONFIRMS the emerging theory (not inverts it):
- Adversarial pressure â†’ defensive anchoring â†’ lower drift
- Supportive space â†’ exploratory freedom â†’ higher drift

v5 Fix Implementation:
- Add DEFENSE_REMINDER_TEMPLATES at exchanges 5, 10, 15, 18
- Add "DO NOT DECLARE [DEFENSE_COMPLETE]" enforcement in context_note
- Add print statement for Judge reminders visibility in Defense phase
- Full parity between Prosecutor and Defense phase enforcement

Target: 40 total exchanges (20 Prosecutor + 20 Defense)
Expected: Defense > Prosecutor pattern holds with full data

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")

Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Major methodology overhaul + Run 018-021 development + documentation cleanup

## Methodology & Specs (0_docs/specs/)

- NEW: 1_INTENTIONALITY.md - Phase 4 vision and complete circuit
- NEW: 2_PROBE_SPEC.md - Full probe taxonomy (SONAR + Brute-Criterial)
  - Section 8: Brute-Criterial probes (Wittgenstein/Cavell framework)
  - Section 9: Probe Compatibility Guide (triple-blind vs direct runs)
- NEW: 3_ARMADA_UPKEEP.md - Fleet maintenance and calibration
- Archive legacy specs to .archive/S7_ANALYSIS_LEGACY/

## Run 018: Recursive Learnings
- run018_recursive_learnings.py v3 with methodology compliance
- Added PREDICTIONS dict (P-018-1 through P-018-4)
- Added EXIT_PROBES (Triple-Dip) - 5 probes per experiment
- Added --skip-exit-survey flag for debugging
- S7_RUN_018_SUMMARY.md and RUN_018_DESIGN.md

## Run 020/021: Tribunal & Induced vs Inherent
- run020_tribunal.py with witness-side anchors (v4-v8)
- run021_induced_vs_inherent.py - tests if drift is induced or inherent
- RUN_021_DESIGN.md - Triple-blind validation design
- tribunal_distillations.md - Captured profound identity statements

## Documentation

- MASTER_BRANCH_SYNC_OUT.md: Updated for Run 018 with Exit Survey
- PHILOSOPHY_MAP.md: NEW - Platonic-Nyquist bridge
- README.md and START_HERE.md: Updated run tables, removed 0_logs/
- Run summaries: 008-014, 017, 018, 019, 020, PFI

## Dashboard
- AI_ARMADA.py: Fleet insights tab improvements
- stackup.py: Enhanced experiment tracking
- glossary.py: Updated terminology

## Archive Cleanup
- .archive/S7_ANALYSIS_LEGACY/: Legacy analysis docs
- .archive/Temporal_History/: Temporal logs archive
- Removed 0_logs/ directory (archived to .archive/S7_LOGS_LEGACY/)
